TextBlock.Text: CASSAVA: I visited Timber Hearth today, Daz. I've given more thought to your proposal.
CASSAVA: I have changed my mind. We must indeed act swiftly to protect these precious native lifeforms, before they are completely wiped out.
CASSAVA: Daz, are you still upset at me? I.. I need your advice.
CASSAVA: ..Are you still working on the <color=orange>Aspiring project?</color>
DAZ: I will reply shortly, Cassava.
CASSAVA: We will use the Inspired to protect the native lifeforms of Timber Hearth, by using its artificial gravity to slowly siphon the deadly matter irradiating it.

CASSAVA: However, it appears likely that <color=orange>mining site 2b</color> will be too enclosed for the Inspired's artificial gravity to reach. It will need to be sealed shut to protect the native lifeforms.

CASSAVA: Afterwards, it may be best for us never to visit Timber Hearth again - not even by shuttle or warp pad. Otherwise, we risk contaminating the sterile environment, or powering a return warp that could transport the lifeforms to irradiated spaces.
